text: Nathaniel Greene is an 1870 marble statue of Nathanael Greene by Henry Kirke Brown, installed in the United States Capitol, in Washington, D.C., as part of the National Statuary Hall Collection. It is one of two statues donated by the state of Rhode Island.Architect of the Capitol Under the Direction of the Joint Committee on the Library, Compilation of Works of Art and Other Objects in the United States Capitol, United States Government Printing Office, Washington 1965 p. 210 The statue portrays Greene dressed in the uniform of a Revolutionary War general, holding a sword in his left hand. Brown later (1877) created an equestrian statue of Greene, also located in Washington, D.C. ==See also== * 1870 in art ==References== ==External links== * Category:1870 establishments in Washington, D.C. Category:1870 sculptures Category:Marble sculptures in Washington, D.C. Category:Monuments and memorials in Washington, D.C. Greene, Nathaniel Category:Sculptures of men in Washington, D.C.
title: Nathanael Greene (Brown)
